data.title: NTS Development Company
data.meta_description: Explore a wide range of career opportunities with NTS Development Company today!
data.text:
The Construction Project Manager is responsible for planning, overseeing, and executing all types of renovation, remodel, and tenant finish projects in our property portfolio. This role requires a strong understanding of construction, project management and the ability to communicate with all stakeholders to ensure projects are completed to NTS Development Company’s high standard of craftmanship on time and within budget. The Project Manager will manage teams consisting of multiple clients, architects, designers, contractors, and other stakeholders. Projects typically range from $25,000 to $10,000,000. This position reports to the Vice President of Construction Services.

Key Responsibilities:

Plan, initiate, and manage projects from conception to completion, ensuring all objectives are met.

Collaborate with ownership, company management, onsite property management and staff, architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors as needed to develop project plans, budgets, and schedules.

Serve as the General Contractor for select projects, bidding out all trades required to fully execute the scope of work on select projects.

Identify, negotiate, and contract with the best contractors.

Procure necessary permits and licenses and ensure compliance with building codes and regulations.

Communicate with all stakeholders to provide project updates and address concerns/questions.

Prepare and maintain project documentation, including progress reports, change orders, and project closeout documents.

Actively manage the project by inspecting work as needed to ensure quality and schedule are being met. Appropriately document issues and concerns with the work and communicate with all stakeholders to resolve them with urgency.

Manage and lead on-site construction teams, subcontractors, and laborers to ensure a clean, safe, efficient, and secure work environment.

Track all materials needed to complete the project and, if needed, place orders when new and/or more materials are needed.

Prepare, circulate, and modify (as needed) work schedules for all trades with collaboration and commitments from each stakeholder.

Manage all financial aspects of the project with the assistance of accounting staff to ensure the project stays on budget.

Report to management any anticipated changes to the budget.

Complete a thorough punch list for all trades to be completed on the scheduled date.

Walk completed work with the stakeholders to ensure the project delivered exceeds their expectations.

Evaluate project performance and conduct post-project reviews/surveys to identify lessons learned and areas for improvement.

Other tasks as assigned by management.

Qualifications and Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or a related field.

Minimum of 5 years of experience in construction project management.

Proficiency in AutoCAD and/or Revitt with drafting experience is preferred

Strong knowledge of construction practices, building codes, and regulations.

Proficiency in project management software and tools.

Excellent communication, leadership, and negotiation skills.

Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and work in a fast-paced environment.

Experience managing budgets and financial aspects of projects.

Knowledge of safety and environmental regulations in construction.

NTS is an equal-opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply

.

Application Instructions: Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, a cover letter outlining their relevant experience, and any additional documents to careers@ntsdevco.com.

Location and Work Environment: This role is primarily based at our Louisville office but may require limited on-site visits to properties in other cities and states.

Full-time position. Qualified candidates must have a valid driver s license and receive positive results from all pre-employment background screenings. Must possess adequate proficiency and communication skills to deliver excellent customer service and to perform general punch requirements, snow removal, equipment upkeep, grounds upkeep, and basic service requests such as: cutting keys, replacing light bulbs/light kits, unclogging toilets, garbage disposal installation/repair, basic water heater repair, basic cleaning and resident services that mirror punch responsibilities. More advanced skills to efficiently and effectively troubleshoot and repair pools, plumbing, appliance, electrical, and carpentry needs of the property. Qualified candidates should be able to work with moderate to minimal direct supervision. Compensation is based on experience. Position available immediately. On-call duty and occasional Saturday work schedules are to be expected.

Location: The Willows Apartments, Louisville, KY

Contact: Property Manager Kristen Taft at ktaft@ntsdevco.com
